container.name: Container
container.description: A container with a maximum width of $screen-lg-max

markup.escaped: <div class="container"></div>

pull left.name: Pull left
pull left.description: Floats an element to the left edge of the container.

markup.modifier: Floating to the left
markup.example: Floating to the left
markup.escaped:
<div class="pull-left">Floating to the left</div>
<div class="clearfix"></div>

pull right.name: Pull right
pull right.description: Floats an element to the right edge of the container.

markup.modifier: Floating to the right
markup.example: Floating to the right
markup.escaped:
<div class="pull-right">Floating to the right</div>
<div class="clearfix"></div>

clearfix.name: Clearfix
clearfix.description: Used to clear floats. Can be used either on a div after a floated element or directly on the container.

markup.escaped: <div class="clearfix"></div>

grid.name: Grid
grid.description:
HbgPrime's grid system is a 12 column responsive grid.
ATTENTION: Remove the .grid-example class before using.

markup.modifier:
grid-md-3
grid-md-9
markup.example:
grid-md-3
grid-md-9

article.name: Article
article.description: A full article with heading, lead and body text

markup.modifier:
Lorem ipsum

Nulla et libero fermentum nisl tempor suscipit quis quis lacus. Sed lacus nisi, condimentum eget sem at, euismod vestibulum quam.

Integer dignissim, augue ac ornare viverra, nulla neque tincidunt ipsum, ac vulputate turpis eros scelerisque dolor. Integer at turpis quam.

Phasellus auctor malesuada diam, ac tincidunt neque venenatis eu. Nulla sit amet erat eleifend magna tincidunt faucibus at in lorem. Quisque nisi felis, vulputate non nibh a, euismod posuere ante. Morbi nec purus sed magna sollicitudin aliquet. Aliquam pulvinar sem at sagittis ullamcorper.

headings.name: Headings
headings.description: Headings for use within articles and more. Please always set the id attribute on headings to enable anchor-linking.

state.name: .text-highlight
state.description: Will highlight any heading in the current theme color

lead.name: Lead
lead.description: A large paragraph to use as article lead.

markup.modifier: Nulla et libero fermentum nisl tempor suscipit quis quis lacus. Sed lacus nisi, condimentum eget sem at, euismod vestibulum quam.

state.name: .unordered-list

small.name: Small
small.description: Small text. Can be used with the <small> element or by applying the .small class to any element.

markup.modifier: <small>This is a small text</small>
markup.example: <small>This is a small text</small>
markup.escaped: <small>This is a small text</small>

base.name: Button base
base.description: The button base with modifiers that can be applied on all types of buttons. The .btn class can be used on button and a elements.

markup.modifier:
<button class="btn">Button base</button>
<button class="btn disabled">Button base</button>
markup.example:
<button class="btn">Button base</button>
<button class="btn disabled">Button base</button>
markup.escaped:
<button class="btn">Button base</button>
<button class="btn disabled">Button base</button>

markup.modifier:
<button class="btn btn-primary">Primary button</button>
<button class="btn btn-primary disabled">Primary button</button>
markup.example:
<button class="btn btn-primary">Primary button</button>
<button class="btn btn-primary disabled">Primary button</button>
markup.escaped:
<button class="btn btn-primary">Primary button</button>
<button class="btn btn-primary disabled">Primary button</button>

markup.modifier:
<button class="btn btn-sm">Small button</button>
<button class="btn">Default button</button>
<button class="btn btn-lg">Large button</button>
markup.example:
<button class="btn btn-sm">Small button</button>
<button class="btn">Default button</button>
<button class="btn btn-lg">Large button</button>

block button.name: Block button
block button.description: Block button spans the full width of the container

markup.modifier:
<button class="btn btn-block">Block button</button>
<button class="btn btn-block btn-primary">Block button</button>
markup.example:
<button class="btn btn-block">Block button</button>
<button class="btn btn-block btn-primary">Block button</button>
markup.escaped:
<button class="btn btn-block">Block button</button>
<button class="btn btn-block btn-primary">Block button</button>

sidebar navigation.name: Navigation
sidebar navigation.description: Vertical navigation a.k.a sidebar navigation with nestled sub menu support.
sidebar navigation.author: Kristoffer Svanmark

state.name: .has-children
state.description: Indicates if a menu item has children (sub menu)

state.name: .current-node
state.description: Indicates the currently active parent node

navbar.name: Navigation bar
navbar.description: The navbar is typically used for the main menu. Using the class .nav-justify on the ul element will make the menu items fill the width of the navbar container.
navbar.author: Kristoffer Svanmark

state.name: .current
state.description: Indicates the currently active menu item

general.name: Stripe
general.description:
The iconic Helsingborg brand stripe.
ATTENTION: Do not use the gray stripe, it's only for demonstration purpose.
general.author: Kristoffer Svanmark
